abstract: Many observers are curious to see whether NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell will suspend former Carolina Panthers defensive end Greg Hardy, now with Dallas Cowboys, over domestic abuse allegations, and whether to let Minnesota Vikings running back Adrian Peterson return after he pleaded no contest to beating his son; NFL installed enhanced penalties and programs at the end of 2014 after fallout from domestic abuse scandals and botched attempts to penalize players.
lead_paragraph: Goodell, the league’s commissioner, is still grappling with the fallout from domestic abuse scandals and botched attempts to penalize players last season.

headline.main: At N.F.L. Owners’ Meeting, Roger Goodell Confronts the Aftermath of Abuse Cases
headline.print_headline: At N.F.L. Owners’ Meeting, Goodell Confronts the Aftermath of Abuse Cases

snippet: Goodell, the league’s commissioner, is still grappling with the fallout from domestic abuse scandals and botched attempts to penalize players last season.
